definitions.text: (computer science) the code that identifies where a piece of information is stored
the place where a person or organization can be found or communicated with
the act of delivering a formal spoken communication to an audience
examples: he listened to an address on minor Roman poets

definitions.text: the manner of speaking to another individual
examples: he failed in his manner of address to the captain

definitions.text: a sign in front of a house or business carrying the conventional form by which its location is described
written directions for finding some location; written on letters or packages that are to be delivered to that location
the stance assumed by a golfer in preparation for hitting a golf ball

examples: He addressed the crowd outside the window
The chairman addressed the board of trustees

definitions.text: address or apply oneself to something, direct one's efforts towards something, such as a question
greet, as with a prescribed form, title, or name
examples: She calls him by first name

definitions.text: act on verbally or in some form of artistic expression
examples: The course covered all of Western Civilization
The new book treats the history of China

definitions.text: adjust and aim (a golf ball) at in preparation of hitting
